bio: Driving Web3 Advancement in Africa through Talent Development & Tech Innovation.
contributionDescription:
We're dedicated to equipping African builders with skills and supporting their innovations to address challenges.
Trained 66 professionals in product design, management, and smart contract engineering.
These professionals showcased their expertise in 10 global hackathons, securing over $17,000 in prizes.
Since April, our community expanded to 1,312 Ethereum and L2-focused builders, actively collaborating and innovating.
Engaged 254 Ghanaian computer science students with the Ethereum Campus Tour, introducing them to blockchain's core concepts.
The Ayathon at Web3Lagos in August 2023, focusing on L2s, featured 18 projects with 104 participants.
Our model equips Africans with skills, fosters community growth, offers global opportunities, and supports innovations for continent-wide adoption.

contributionLinks.description: Projects built during the Ayathon (28th September to 2nd of August)

impactDescription: We have played a pivotal role in beginning to bridge the knowledge gap around Ethereum and L2s, including Optimism and Base, on the African continent. By cultivating a community of passionate builders, we have equipped a new wave of innovators with the tools and understanding they need to harness the power of blockchain technology. These projects confront diverse challenges, from preserving African heritage to introducing digital identity solutions. By also facilitating educational outreaches and deepening collaborations, we've expanded our influence. Regular feedback loops and mentorship programs further solidify our impact. We're wholeheartedly convinced that enabling African builders to solve local dilemmas will exponentially boost blockchain acceptance continent-wide.

bio: Researcher & Content Creator focusing on modular scaling, rollups & zk tech!
contributionDescription:
As a researcher & content creator with a strong focus on rollups, modular scaling and zk tech, I have published a lot of educational resources to educate people on how rollups work, why they matter and what the benefits, drawbacks, differences & underlying trust assumptions of these systems are. 

While a lot of my content is aimed at a rather broad audience of users that can range from non-technical to tech-savvy, I also create more in-depth / technical content on modular blockchain architecture & zk tech. This kind of content, is slightly more geared towards a technical audience including builders and devs. The goal is to empower them to build out customized & optimized execution layers on top of Ethereum's battle-tested security guarantees that are more performant and secure.

bio: Ethers.js is a simple, compact and complete library for everything Ethereum.
contributionDescription:
Ethers.js is currently the most popular JavaScript library for Ethereum (and ilk) with over 1 million weekly npm installs (over 110 million, all time)  and is in the top 500 NPM packages by dependents.

Ethers has worked closely with the OP team to collaborate on the custom OP extension package as well as integrate new plug-ins for tuning network performance (such as custom priority fees), which are all built-in and automatically used for OP-detected networks.

Ethers is also used by many of the other tools and projects which help enable Optimism, such as MetaMask, Uniswap and Hardhat.
impactDescription:
The impact provided by Ethers has been a simple and popular developer library.

Many aspects of Ethers favour simplicity and safety-by-default, such as "garbage-in, fail loud" (opposed to "garbage-in, garbage-out", which often results in unsafe or error prone behaviour) which has helped protect developers and end-users from innocent mistakes, which could be costly or dangerous in the the blockchain world. Making it difficult to build a foot-gun is a feature.

By being so widely used, it has also led to the development of many other projects on top of it, further expanding the ecosystem.

bio: We write smart contracts that facilitate the open exchange of ideas and value.
contributionDescription: This submission is for our NFT Market. Its contracts allow for any ERC20 to be exchanged for any ERC721. To our knowledge there are no other contracts on Optimism, or on any chain, that allow this functionality. We addressed UI / UX issues voiced by Optimism users, particularly for veNFTs. The fee (1%) is the lowest among all NFT Markets on Optimism.
impactDescription:
Most NFTs are exchanged for ETH, a volatile currency. This volatility inhibits price discovery by inextricably tying the value of an NFT to the value of ETH. Vote-escrowed NFTs, which tokenize the value of a governance position in projects like Solidly and Velodrome, add an additional (often volatile) token to this equation. 

The market struggled to evaluate these positions in ETH. By allowing listings in stables, sellers can fix a stable floor price; allowing listings in the underlying token, e.g., listings of veVELO for VELO, the seller creates a zero-slippage offer - if VELO's price moves, the price of veVELO necessarily follows as veVELO is VELO (albeit vote-escrowed). 

Since its launch, our NFT Market volume is several times the volume of all other NFT Markets on Optimism combined.

bio: Most Used 4337 UserOp Explorer for Account Abstraction
contributionDescription:
EIP 4337 introduced new abstracts entities called UserOps, Bundler, paymater and factory, which are not understood by the underlying ethereum protocol. 
Thus no infrastructure component recognizes these entities unless specifically designed for it.
Jiffyscan is the only tool to let you explore details of a UserOp introduced by ERC-4337, just by giving the UserOp Hash.
Users can explore details across 16 different mainnets and testnets.
There's a data API available as well to query the details of a given UserOp, currently for free.

contributionLinks.description: APIs available for free for wallet developers building on 4337 ecosystem

impactDescription:
1.The tools is most helpful for developers to confirm the status of a UserOp and share it with their teammates or users, as no other tool currently supports search/lookup by a UserOp.
2. The Explorer is actively used by the developers of the top teams empowering 4337.
3. The explorer has seen a Cumulative Monthly Growth of 27% for the last 5 months in terms of page views, with the september hitting ~18k views. 
4. We have had 26 teams request for our APIs and are the most performant and rich historical UserOp lookup service out there

bio: Token house and Citizen house governance app and contract
contributionDescription:
Agora builds public gov infra that is open source for Optimism community builders to leverage. We focus on 3 areas of contribution:

- vote.optimism.io client where we enable Token and Citizen House to vote, delegate and evaluate proposals and RPGF. Over 500,000 monthly visits.
- Major governor upgrade that enables net new functionalities such as Approval Voting that powered Season 4 Intents.
- Open API that powers other community members and clients such as Supermodular client in RetroPGF3.

No other on-chain governance has Approval Voting as Optimism has, weâ€™re proud to be contributing alongside a community thatâ€™s at the bleeding edge of governance.

contributionLinks.description: Voting client app for Token House and Citizen House
Open-source repo of delegation, proposals and voting client for Optimism Agora.
Governor contract for Optimism's Token House governance.
Open-source repo of on-chain governor that powers token house voting. MIT.
Liquid delegation smart contract, enables re-delegation, liquid functions. MIT.
RetroPGF API and Client. MIT licensed

impactDescription:
By building the best-in-class governor contract & application for the Collective, we increased accountability, transparency, and decentralization for all projects in the Collective while maintaining high bars on accessibility and ease of use.

We have over 3,000 active delegate with profiles created on Optimism, along with over 400,000 votes casted and 100,000 unique monthly users. Over 1,000,000 delegation events have been made on Optimism.

Through on-chain Approval Voting, over 6M OP has been allocated to fund projects in Season 4 in a decentralized manner.

Our app & contract are open source and MIT-licensed for any builder to leverage. Additionally, with the OPâ€™s superchain coming into play â€” we plan to ship a 1 click deploy governance package for DAOs on top of OP Stack chains.

bio: Tally is an onchain governance app for Ethereum ecosystem
contributionDescription: Tally made several impactful contributions to the Optimism Collective over the past year, including developing a delegate portal, producing an in-depth technical research report on Superchain governance, and facilitating Delegation Week (an ecosystem-wide event focused on governance participation). Tally also built an L2 governance voting protocol on Optimism called Rollcall in early 2022.

contributionLinks.description: Optimism Collective Mission: Superchain Governance Research Report
Rollcall, an L2 governance voting protocol on Optimism
5-day ecosystem-wide event dedicated to DAO governance engagement

impactDescription:
Tally's contributions have made Optimism Collective governance accessible and future-proof. 

Accessible:
- Tally's Optimism delegate portal makes it easy to discover and track the performance of Token House delegates. 
- Delegation Week re-engaged OP token holders with Optimism Collective governance and elevated the voices of Token House delegates. 

Future-proof:
- Tally's Superchain Governance Deep Dive Mission produced the most complete and up-to-date analysis of the state of crosschain governance. We deeply investigated and produced documentation around all of the viable paths for expanding Token House governance across the Superchain and ultimately recommended a zk-SNARK based approach that scales to thousands of chains and millions of users.

bio: Ethical, safe, resilient and diverse economic systems to benefit the world.
contributionDescription: The Token Engineering Commons (TEC) supports the economic development of the field of token engineering. Since its launch in early 2022, the TEC has granted $470K to bringing engineering rigor to the development of crypto-economic systems. These grants build public faith that is critical to the widespread adoption of blockchain technologies. Our support has also directly benefited Optimism, including Inverterâ€™s programmable smart contract workflows, cadCADâ€™s Ethereum models, Gravity DAOâ€™s dispute resolution, Praiseâ€™s peer-based attested reputation, and the Token Engineering Academyâ€™s graduates. Additionally, the TEC attracts token engineering practitioners to the Optimism developer ecosystem by running our Gitcoin Token Engineering Grants Round on Optimism.

Infusing expertise into Quadratic Funding with OP-based NFTs

impactDescription:
Optimism is now benefiting from TEC cultural investments in Praise and Gravity. Our $174K in grants to the Token Engineering Academy has helped grow Optimismâ€™s talent pool with graduates like Jonas, who now runs its RetroPGF. Other relevant TEC grants include:

- $30K to Inverter, whose programmable smart contract workflows help app developers deploy on Optimism.
- $54K to cadCAD, a tool used by the EF and others for Ethereum research (e.g. beacon chain, EIP-1559)

Our latest Gitcoin Token Engineering Grants Round generated 2,608 contributions from 1,837 individuals on Optimism. It also uses Optimism-based â€œknowledge proofâ€ NFTs to give an â€œexpertise boostâ€ to 192 Academy students. These rounds help bring the highly technical token engineering community to the Optimism developer ecosystem.

bio: Love Crypto
contributionDescription: Currently, the Optimism Foundation runs the sole sequencer on OP Mainnet. This does not mean that Optimism can censor user transactions. However, it is still desirable to decentralize the sequencer over time, eliminating Optimism's role entirely so that anyone can participate in the network as a block producer.
impactDescription: As part of the OVM 2.0 upgrade, the Optimism fault proof mechanism had to be temporarily disabled. This means that users of the OP Mainnet network currently need to trust the Sequencer node (run by Optimism Foundation) to publish valid state roots to Ethereum. You can read more about our security model

bio: My creations merge digital and physical, embodying significant blockchain events
contributionDescription:
I am Xofee, a mechanical artist, creating marvels like the 'Opti Maze,' 'KZG Marble Machine,' and 'Onchain Illusion,' each narrating significant blockchain milestones. 
My project, the 'KZG Marble Machine,' was crafted for the KZG ceremony, a pivotal moment in enhancing Layer 2 capacities on Ethereum. It encapsulated the blockchain's essence, creating a useful spectacle appreciated and featured in notable podcasts like Bankless' Weekly Rollupâ€™ and the Daily Gwei.
'Opti Maze' was a tribute to Optimism on OPcraft. 'Onchain Illusion,' created for the Onchain Summer event, symbolizes the amalgamation of art and blockchain.
Through the RetroPGF 3 initiative, I seek to secure support that will further fuel my quest to blend the abstract blockchain concepts with tangible mechanical artistry.

contributionLinks.description: The KZG Marble Machine is a mechanical art piece which generates randomness
Onchain Illusion designed for the Onchain Summer event
Opti Maze is an inventive maze crafted in honor of Optimism on OPcraft

impactDescription: My contributions, notably through the 'KZG Marble Machine', 'Opti Maze', and 'Onchain Illusion', have visually encapsulated pivotal blockchain moments, fostering a deeper appreciation for the technology among the Optimism Collective. By blending the physical with the digital, my creations have offered a tangible narrative, enriching the community's engagement with Optimism's progressive journey, and highlighting the boundless creative potential within the blockchain domain. I distribute all 3D printing files and my programs as open source.

bio: https://r72.fi/
contributionDescription:
I have created r72.fi free funding rate aggregated website to give everyone a bigger picture of on-chain and off-chain perpetual future funding rate stats.

It's really hard to know the actual cost of on-chain or off-chain platforms' funding rate for a certain long period. Hence, r72.fi solves the mathematical and UX issues to make everyone know more about the funding rate. Especially, those on-chain funding rates. It's way harder for users to understand. 

r72.fi supports two projects deployed on Optimism, Perpetual Protocol and Synthetix.  People can easily check those two projects' aggregated funding rates without on-chain knowledge.
impactDescription: The attached metrics show that https://r72.fi/'s top 3 active pages including Perpetual Protocol and Kwenta throughout the past 1 year (Actually, https://r72.fi has helped Perpetual Protocol user to know their funding rate stats since 2021.). r72.fi is just a small site (DAU 10ish, MAU 100ish) and impacts quite a lot of Perpetual Protocol and Kwenta users.

bio: Building Unlock Protocol to create a better web
contributionDescription:
Unlock Labs, the creators of Unlock Protocol, will enhance the features and functionality of Events, an application built to bring events onchain on Optimism.

Events by Unlock Labs is a free and easy way organizers can create events (contracts deployed on Optimism) and share an event details page for 10-10000+ person where users can claim or purchase tickets. Setting up an event takes less than a minute, and it works for both free and paid events.

contributionLinks.description: Unlock Protocol's Contracts on Optimism (Deployed on Nov-21-2021)

impactDescription:
Consumer use cases for Optimism are critical to increasing onboarding, adoption, and usage. Events are an obvious use case for Optimism, enabling people with and without crypto wallets to register for or buy tickets to an event.

Legacy ticketing solutions donâ€™t meet the needs of web3 and crypto event organizers.

Events by Unlock Labs enables no-code event creation, deploying a smart contract to Optimism that creates tickets that include event details, metadata, and other information relevant to an event. Enhancing the features and functionality of Events allows crypto-centric event organizers using web2 platforms (Eventbrite, Luma, Partiful) to embrace the technology their attendees expect them to champion..

bio: Web3 product studio
contributionDescription:
We built the Superbridge (https://superbridge.app), an all in one solution for bridging assets to and from chains in the Superchain.

The Superbridge supports bridging ETH and ERC20 tokens to and from OP Mainnet, Base and Zora. With deployments to Mode, PGN, Orderly Network, Ancient8, Lyra and Aevo planned in the short term.

We've also partnered with Conduit (https://conduit.xyz), offering all testnets launched via their platform a free deployment of the Superbridge. You can read their announcement about the integration here https://twitter.com/KAndrewHuang/status/1707065523274739854.
impactDescription:
We're giving chains the ability to launch a user friendly bridge on the same day as they launch their mainnet or testnet network. We saw the launch of Base, where users were sending funds directly to a contract on Etherscan and thought that this needn't be the UX the Superchain is striving for.

On top of basic token bridging functionality, our easy mode feature enables users to not worry about coming back to prove (2 hours later) and finalize (7 days later) their withdrawals - Fugu Works does it for them. Drastically improving the withdrawal process and cutting transactions needed from users from 3 to 1.

bio: Web3 engineer

- listening and reacting to swaps made on Uniswap
- permissionless & automated Chainlink feeds on the L2.

The mod includes changes to op-node, for deriving events and an additional predeploy for registering events.

This example shows event parsing, L2 state reads and L2 writes.

bio: Decentralized and open-source Solidity contract source code verification service
contributionDescription:
Sourcify provides an open-source alternative to existing proprietary source code verification tools for contracts

Anyone can run their own Sourcify to trustlessly verify contracts. It's also a knowledge-gathering point for verification, whereas with close source tools, the learnings in verification and the exceptions that need to be handled are not shared with the community.

The data is open. You don't need to scrape to bulk download contracts. The contract repository is published to IPFS and S3 buckets regularly. 

Sourcify also aims to foster the "full matches" with contract metadata hashes. This ensures cryptographic guarantees for the exactness of the contract. It's nicely demonstrated at playground.sourcify.dev.
impactDescription:
We are raising awareness on several fronts:
- Easy and open access to verified smart contracts
- Benefits of Solidity's contract metadata and its appended hash in the onchain bytecode
- Centralization in source code verification tools and providing alternatives

We support 109 EVM chains, among those using OP Stack e.g. OP networks, and Base. We also "monitor" those networks to catch contract creations and verify automatically if the source code is published on IPFS.

bio: OpenEthereum client developer. Cowswap backend developer.
contributionDescription:
I was involved in implementing key features for "Berlin" and especially "London" hard fork for Ethereum mainnet client - OpenEthereum. At that time, OpenEtherem had a share of 15% of all Ethereum mainnet nodes. 
One of my main contributions was EIP1559 implementation (fee mechanism) for OpenEtherem.
Except that, I was part of regular ETH DEV calls and main responsible for testing the client and communicating with other client team developers.
Other than that, I also contributed to rust-web3 library.
Other than that, I am one of the main developers of Cowswap backend project (https://github.com/cowprotocol/services), a decentralized exchange aiming to tackle the MEV problem and improve prices for end users by batching ofchain intent trades.

contributionLinks.description: EIP1559 implementation for OpenEthereum. Received London POAP for this.
eth_feeHistory RPC endpoint implementation for widely used web3 rust library
Consensus bug fixed on geth (to show the impact of OpenEthereum contributions)

impactDescription:
At the time of my contributions to OpenEthereum, this client had ~15% of all ethereum mainnet nodes share, the second biggest share, right after Geth. Unfortenately, the project was shut down after some time, due to lack of funding.
OpenEthereum London hard fork discovered a critical bug in Geth client on one of the test networks just before the mainnet activation. Obviously, this prevented a serious consensus bug between geth client and the rest of the clients. London hard fork also contained the EIP1559 implementation - change in the fee mechanism for Ethereum.
I also had contributions to rust web3 library widely used for all rust projects on ethereum and EVM compatible chains and also contributed to Cowswap project which main impact is protecting users from MEV and giving best prices.

bio: The local-first, opensource asset tracking and management tool for crypto/tradfi
contributionDescription:
Rotki has made significant contributions to Optimism. From early days, rotki recognized the potential of Optimism as an L2 and was the first EVM chain to be integrated

It supports many Optimism protocols and superchain capabilities making it a versatile and indispensable tool for those navigating the ecosystem

Its innovative decoding system for transactions has greatly enhanced user experience. Optimism users have praised it as a more user-friendly alternative to Etherscan

It also offers PnL reports, allowing Optimism users to do accounting in a privacy preserving way

Its contributions encompass opensource code, tracking, protocols support, user-friendly decoding system and PnL accounting. These have solidified rotki's role as a vital platform within the Optimistic Ethereum community

contributionLinks.description: Our main repository, where all our opensource work resides
A plain text accounting tool, made by someone else based on our opensource code
A chrome addon to decode etherscan/optimismscan transactions based on our code

impactDescription:
rotki has left an indelible mark on optimism. By running locally on users machines, it ensures their financial data remains private and secure. By being opensource it provides transparency.

Its unwavering support for optimism began early; it was the first EVM chain integrated after mainnet, boasting broad protocol support. Its decoding system won praise from users, offering more user-friendly transaction visibility than etherscan.

Its PnL reporting aids optimism users in accounting for their activities, helping them make sense of their financials.

Its opensource nature has spurred collaboration within the community. It has given rise to projects like Buchfink and Decodify, which have further enriched the ecosystem by providing plaintext accounting and decoding solutions respectively.

bio: 1st French-speaking media about crypto
contributionDescription:
As an education and information medium, we've been following Optimism's progress closely and have detailed it in numerous articles.

Very early on (in April 2022) we offered a comprehensive guide to our community, entitled "Optimism: the first optimistic rollups solution to improve Ethereum (ETH) scalability". This enabled them to discover the ecosystem and understand how it works, as well as its advantages.

Afterwards, we covered a number of news items, such as the $150 million fundraising in March 2022, the airdrop in June 2022, or more technical topics like the improvements brought about by the Bedrock update. We also reported on the network's successes, with articles on the number of active addresses and the number of transactions.

impactDescription:
Thanks to our various articles, we've enabled the French-speaking community to discover Optimism through a medium in which they have full confidence.

We've enabled them to understand how Optimism works and its relevance to today's challenges, to learn how to interact with the ecosystem, and to follow the project's news on a regular basis.

We also covered the launch of the token to highlight its potential interest for investors and regular DeFi users.

We are likely to have redirected our community of 10 million readers (in 2022) towards Optimism in a neutral, objective but enthusiastic way.

contributionDescription: While there are plenty of Solidity libraries out there, nobody has been working on high-quality, secure, and easy-to-integrate library-like Vyper code. ðŸ snekmate fundamentally changed this! In one sentence: ðŸ snekmate are state-of-the-art, highly opinionated, hyper-optimised, and secure Vyper smart contract building blocks. bio: Ethereum HD Wallet derivation library in Go
contributionDescription: The `go-ethereum-hdwallet` library is a component within the OP Stack and is also widely utilized throughout the broader Ethereum ecosystem. In the context of the OP Stack, this library plays a crucial role in deriving an HD wallet private key from a mnemonic seed phrase, which is then employed by the sequencer service to sign transactions.
impactDescription: The go-ethereum-hdwallet library has been included in the OP Stack since 2022 and remains in use by the Optimism sequencer service. Its adoption in 900+ Go projects on Github shows its broad impact, reliability, and functionality in the wider ecosystem.

bio: Arbiter is a free and open source EVM logic simualtor
contributionDescription: Arbiter is a public good security and analysis tool for the EVM ecosystem. The tool kit is free and open source and able to audit mechanism design which has historically been challenging. The tool is also able to model risk across many stochastic processes and historical data. The EVM logic simulator has been used to find critical vulnerabilities in the Portfolio smart contract system that auditors were previously unable to identify. Because of the tools speed and EVM execution parity, it allows for unparalleled quality and quantity of testing data for any smart contract system or application. As optimism maintains support for the EVM execution environment and is an extensive smart contract system, tooling across to ecosystem to help improve safety and security is paramount.
impactDescription: Through the development of Arbiter, we have grown the developer ecosystem from the ground up. We have helped engineers to understand the security implications and nuances to building modular smart contract systems and how to identify undesirable anomaly behavior. Now the tool is being used by auditing firms, protocol designers, academics and searchers to model their systems and applications with speed, rigor, and EVM execution parity. Overall these contributions help ensure the security and safety of complex systems like the OP Stack while also growing the size and quality of the developer ecosystem which in turn improves the end user experience and adoption by improving the safety and security of end user applications.

bio: Independent Ethereum educator, investor & advisor. Founder of The Daily Gwei.
contributionDescription:
I have been a long-time educator in the Ethereum ecosystem stretching back to early 2018 when I created my first newsletter, Block by Block. Through that newsletter, I provided weekly updates to the community about the crypto ecosystem.

In late 2018, I co-founded EthHub alongside Eric Conner which was an Ethereum education hub consisting of an open-source documentation website, a weekly newsletter, and a weekly podcast (Into the Ether). Through EthHub, Eric and I educated tens of thousands of people about Ethereum.

In mid 2020, I founded The Daily Gwei which I consider to be the spiritual successor to EthHub. I have written over 500 small educational newsletter blogs and produced over 650 videos about Ethereum. The Daily Gwei also has a very active Discord server.
impactDescription:
I have covered the Optimism ecosystem extensively through all of my educational channels - stretching all the way back to when the founding Optimism team was known as 'Plasma Group'. You can see a tweet here form 2019 where I was one of the first people to interact with an early optimistic rollup demo called 'UniPig' (https://twitter.com/sassal0x/status/1181495761281773569).

Through my coverage, I have educated tens of thousands of people about the OP Stack, Optimism's RPGF initiatives and layer 2's generally. This education also continued through conversations in The Daily Gwei Discord server where like-minded individuals discuss Optimism's strategy around the 'Superchain' and taking on a 'subtractive' development philosophy.

bio: Hi! I'm an open source contributor to the Optimism ecosystem!
contributionDescription:
Name: Optimism Gas Tracker
Website: https://optimismgastracker.com
Description: A website that displays real time gas prices, estimated cost for common transaction types, and the Top Gas Guzzlers and Top Gas Spenders. 

Name: Optimism Transaction Replay Tool
Website: https://optimism-transaction-replay.vercel.app
Description: A utility UI to replay failed L1->L2 or L2->L1 cross-chain messenger transactions. It allows a user to connect an account and shows which transactions can be replayed. It allows setting a higher gas limit and previewing if the transaction will succeed or fail.

Name: Github Attestation Action and Bot
Website: https://github.com/apps/pr-attestation
Description: A tool that allows developers to integrate the Ethereum Attestation Service into their CI workflow.
impactDescription:
Optimism Gas Tracker:
Gives users a better understanding of OP mainnet gas fee activity. 

Optimism Transaction Replay Tool:
Improve user experience who face L1->L2 or L2->L1 cross-chain messenger transaction failures by using an easy to use UI and removing the need to use a technical SDK.

Github Attestation Action and Bot: 
Helps projects on Github keep track of their contributors by creating automated attestations.

bio: Proof of Personhood from your government ID
contributionDescription:
Proof of Personhood is one way to enable democratic systems on chain that distribute voting power to each person instead of based on the size of the wallet. Coinpassport makes it easy to provide a strong signal to your individual humanity by linking your passport to your Ethereum wallet. For a fee of 3 USDC, Coinpassport uses Stripe Identity to verify your face matches your passport.

Coinpassport has been live on Optimism mainnet since May 14, 2022 and has received 22 fee payments in that time.

contributionLinks.description: Coinpassport organization on Github (frontend and contracts)
PR for Integration with Gitcoin Passport

impactDescription:
Anyone can build applications that use verified passports using Coinpassport.

I made a no-code DAO construction dAPP (https://democratic.capital/) which requires all users to have verified using Coinpassport in order to make groups, launch tokens, create elections, and custom liquidity pools.

I've also created a pull request for Gitcoin Passport to add a Coinpassport stamp so that users can onboard faster and easier by producing a stamp that would cost a lot to forge. I have not been able to make contact with anyone at Gitcoin about receiving feedback on this integration.

fundingSources.description: Revenue from fee collection (not profit)

bio: Director of Product at Molecule
contributionDescription:
We're a DAO accelerator for patient communities, and we've crafted two tools on Optimism:

Token Vesting Contract: It allows bounties for patient contributors, ensuring long-term commitment while granting immediate voting rights. This promotes genuine community participation over speculation.

NFT Badges via Otterspace: To meet Swiss regulations, we issue NFT badges post KYC/AML checks for contributions over 1,000 Swiss Francs. The NFTs, with embedded metadata, ensure contributors are verified, making the donation process seamless and compliant.

Your support can amplify our community-driven mission.

contributionLinks.description: Example vesting contract for hair loss patient community.

impactDescription:
At our DAO accelerator for patient communities, our contributions on Optimism have been twofold:

Token Vesting Contract: Deployed on Optimism, this not only saved costs but also optimized transaction speeds. It promotes genuine, long-term community involvement by providing immediate voting rights to contributors, aligning with Optimism's ethos of community empowerment.

NFT Badges via Otterspace: To streamline the compliance process, we used Optimism for efficient NFT minting, ensuring that sizable contributions remain transparent and trustworthy. This approach has showcased Optimismâ€™s potential in regulatory use-cases, further diversifying its applicability.

Our efforts aim to enhance Optimism's community-centric vision.

impactDescription: Jessy's hacker house and the Optimism Collective share a profound synergy in their commitment to Ethereum's sustainable future. The single requirement for residents of Jessy's hacker house, is that whatever they build, it must be free open source. bio: Blockchain developer
contributionDescription:
I am driven by the commitment to bridge the knowledge gap in the blockchain ecosystem, specifically in the realm of blockchain engineering. Despite the increasing interest in this field, there is a noticeable scarcity of comprehensive educational resources that span from foundational knowledge to intricate concepts. To that end, I've envisioned a project dedicated to delivering blockchain engineering knowledge, making it accessible to anyone keen on diving into this domain.

My contributions to the Ethereum ecosystem and the Optimism Collective are already evident through my writings and educational repositories, notably the 'Yul by Example' GitHub repo. This repository serves as an educational guide and has already garnered appreciation from many: Yul by Example.
impactDescription: The tangible impact of this project would be evident in the form of a well-informed community equipped with the necessary knowledge to drive further innovations in the Ethereum and Optimism ecosystems. By fostering a deep understanding of blockchain engineering principles, we can expect a surge in the quality and quantity of decentralized applications, infrastructure developments, and novel solutions catering to real-world problems.

bio: Sonne Finance is a decentralized lending protocol, native on Optimism.
contributionDescription: As the premier native lending protocol on Optimism, Sonne Finance has significantly bolstered the Optimism ecosystem, solidifying our status as the world's largest OP lending market. Our collaboration with Velodrome Finance stands as a testament to innovation, illustrating how Velodrome can serve as a liquidity hub, inspiring other protocols to launch on Optimism. Embodying the true spirit of "optimism", we've championed community growth: from assisting newcomers with wallet setups, sharing knowledge about other protocols, to helping developers aspiring to make their mark on Optimism.

bio: OPStack improvement with ERC-4337 account and native hardware signature verifier
contributionDescription:
Opclave has been one of the finalists among 306 projects at the Scaling Ethereum Hackathon of ETHGlobal by introducing hardware signatures in account abstraction for the first time in the OPStack ecosystem

The Showcase prepared at the ETHGlobal hackathon received significant engagement from the ecosystem, thus introducing Optimism's OP Stack product. Additionally, the Twitter thread featuring Opclave gained over 600K views, contributing to the popularity of OP Stack

The Clave team proposed EIP-7212 to enable the use of the P256 curve. Following this, many individuals from the ecosystem began development on the P256 curve. The Ledger team further developed the work of Opclave. Extensive discussions took place on builder forums, and numerous tweets were posted on Twitter regarding EIP-7212

contributionLinks.description: EIP-7212: Precompiled for secp256r1 Curve Support
ETH Global Scaling Ethereum 2023 Showcase Page
Opclave's Account Contract on Optimism Goerli Testnet
Opclave's Paymaster Contract on Optimism Goerli Testnet
Opclave's Entrypoint Contract on Optimism Goerli Testnet

impactDescription:
Providing one of the first examples of hardware signing on OP Stack drew the community's attention toward Optimism. The popular thread received not only 600K views but also got RT support from nearly 500 individuals.

After the development of Opclave, Renaud from the Ledger team conducted a study and published an article aimed at reducing the gas fee costs of the 'verifier' contract. This article prompted the entire ecosystem to examine the usage of secp256r1 in OP Stack. 

At a time when there were very few projects utilizing OP Stack technology, Opclave emerged and led the way for other projects. After Opclave, many projects worked on Hardware Signing and produced products. 

All of these have contributed to increasing the awareness of Optimism Collective among even more people.

bio: Extract ABI (and more) from EVM bytecode, even without source code.
contributionDescription:
WhatsABI is a public good for making EVM bytecode more useful and usable on all EVM-based chains, such as mainnet and OP Stack chains.

The guiding purpose for WhatsABI is to improve decentralization, transparency, and user safety by reducing our dependence on proprietary frontends to EVM contracts. 

WhatsABI a permissively-licensed TypeScript library that is perfect for building better contract explorers (a better Etherscan), transaction builders (Safe Wallet), smarter wallets (MetaMask, Zapper), and for doing security research. It is designed to be small, fast, and easily embedded in wallets or runnable locally with any provider.

Many tools already use WhatsABI: gnosis/zodiac-pilot, paradigmxyz/rivet, ondora.xyz, monobase.xyz, ethcmd.com, notar-cli, abi.w1nt3r.xyz, and more!

contributionLinks.description: Extract ABIs (and more) from EVM bytecode, even without source code.

impactDescription:
The features that WhatsABI offers are important for all EVM-powered blockchains, including those under the Optimism Collective.

Many of the tools that already use WhatsABI are operating on OP Stack powered chains: Rivet, Zodiac, Ondora, etc.

By using WhatsABI, all of these tools get many features out of the box: Easy fetching of ABIs from verified contracts, extracting ABIs from unverified contracts, detecting and resolving proxies, and more. (See Github project page for more details.)

Anyone building generalized frontends (like block explorers) knows how hard it is to do these things reliably. One example: Resolving proxy contracts. There's many kinds (EIP-1967, GnosisSafeProxy, ZeppelinOSProxy, PROXIABLE, DiamondProxy, and more)â€”WhatsABI detects and resolves all of them!

bio: Advancing Deliberative Governance (aka Sortition) for Web3
contributionDescription:
My contribution to the collective is still indirect. But please consider it as a broad contribution to make Web3 governance much more inclusive, legitimate and resilient. This work also helps to Collective by showing that it is not only possible but also relevant to deploy deliberative governance for better decisions. It's a public good in the making for all blockchain ecosystems. 

Now to the contribution: I pilot the approach of Citizens' Assemblies in the broader Web3 ecosystem. I am leading a pilot of Citizens' Assembly in the Cosmos Ecosystem. I will be able to bring this work to the Optimism Ecosystem to pilot it there next year.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/14ZIPZQ-YSI8T0yAmFiFfjw65eytCtf2KrAiijdo_raE/edit#heading=h.tyjcwt

contributionLinks.description: Lists of core documents of the Assembly

impactDescription:
The impact is to prove that it is possible to make Web3 governance much more solid by using tools of collective intelligence and sortition based deliberative democracy. 

The key is that it is extremely difficult to deploy the first pilot because the field is very reluctant to non technical solutions. However, the state of current governance is very bad and we need new ways to approach governance. 

I needed almost 2 years to make this first pilot possible. I share all learnings and experiences with the collective so we can all learn from it and deploy improved versions in the future.

bio: Author of "Layer 2 Landscape" threads, & manager of node infra at Infura.
contributionDescription:
My "Layer 2 Landscape" threads are a labor of love intended as a public good & educational resource. My threads focus on protocol updates, writings around difficult questions such as prover architecture, & educational materials written by the amazing giga-brains in our niche of the Ethereum world. By the time voting begins on this round, I will have written over 70 threads.

I've also made contributions to the Optimism ecosystem in my role at Consensys. At Truffle, I built the Optimism Truffle Box & lead the Optimism Bridge Box as a starting point for developers. Now as an Engineering Manager at Infura, I'm responsible for the operation of Infuraâ€™s nodes, including Optimism & Base. Further, I continue to educate my colleagues about Layer 2 & how we can best support Ethereum scaling.

contributionLinks.description: A recent Twitter thread as an example of my work.

Optimism Truffle Box, providing initial configuration and a detailed readme.

impactDescription:
By regularly summarizing and explaining the importance of new developments in the L2 space, I lower the barrier to entry for community members who want to get involved. The speed at which the Ethereum scaling space moves can make people feel like they have "already missed" their chance to contribute, and my threads help people catch up and figure out where they can make the most impact. 

Additionally, writing these threads has allowed me to synthesize the information and provide additional education to the community, like my 2023 L2 predictions thread and my Lightning Talk at DevCon on themes and trends in Layer 2.

bio: Co-Founder @Angle Labs, Contributor @AngleProtocol, Warden and Judge @code4rena
contributionDescription:
This repository is an open-source solidity code analyzer.

Its goal is to detect common vulnerabilities in smart contracts, leveraging an analysis of the Abstract Syntax Tree generated by the solidity compiler and regexes.

Ultimately, it's a tool that smart-contract developers should run on their code prior to auditing or releasing it to improve their security processes.

contributionLinks.description: Github repository of the static analyzer

impactDescription: This repository has been used by many projects to run against their smart contracts and detect common vulnerabilities, participating in the global security of the ecosystem. But more importantly, many security researchers have used this codebase to build their own version and vulnerability detectors so it now powers a lot of these automated audit tools.

bio: Making Web3 Safer for Everyone
contributionDescription:
We've recently launched Wallet Watch, Webacy's real time notification, monitoring, and alerts system, on Optimism. The service has been well loved on Ethereum mainnet (over 25k users, 300k transactions a month, over 150M assets under monitoring), and we are so excited to bring Webacy safety tools to the Optimism ecosystem.

Wallet Watch allows users to monitor all of their wallets and accounts, receiving real time SMS and email notifications whenever ANYTHING interacts with their wallet. This means inbound and outbound transactions, airdrops, royalty payments, and even things like spam drops, drains, and other potentially malicious transactions. We believe knowledge is power. We're so excited to bring these self-custody safety tools to Optimism, making the chain safer for users!

contributionLinks.description: Our main dapp! Check out the Wallet Watch feature for yourself on Optimism!

impactDescription: Webacy began in order to build better safety and UI tools for users to navigate the blockchain. We found great success on Ethereum mainnet, and were excited to bring our services to the amazing communities and projects on Optimism. After a lot of hard work, its' finally live, and we're so pumped to bring these safety tools to the ecosystem! Now any user on Optimism can monitor interactions, transactions, and assets on-chain, for as many wallets as they'd like! This not only brings more transparency to the space, but it also helps with the entire user experience, trust, and interaction across the communities.

fundingSources.description: Actually None! This would be our first OP received for our work (no 0 option)

bio: An adventure game to learn about Web3 in a fun way, without any technical jargon
contributionDescription:
Our contribution to Optimism involves the development of an educational project known as Revolte, which serves as a platform for individuals to gain knowledge about web3 technology. 
This interactive adventure game commences with the setup of your initial digital wallet, guiding users through the process if they don't already possess one. To progress further in the game, participants are required to undertake essential actions, such as executing transactions on the Optimism network. It's important to note that, at present, Optimism is the exclusive network available for engagement within our game.
impactDescription:
Revolte, was introduced in March 2023, and within a short span until the end of September 2023, it has already facilitated the creation of more than 1600 new Web3 wallets. These wallets were instrumental in introducing users to the broader Web3 ecosystem, marking a significant milestone in our journey.

However, it's important to emphasize that this is just the beginning of our impact. Our next endeavor is the launch of the upcoming chapter, which is dedicated to delving into the existing protocols on the mainnet. We aim to seamlessly integrate every interaction with these protocols into our narrative, ensuring that the experience remains captivating and engaging for our users.

I included images and solutions to issues / potential improvements I found. I believe it's important to provide solutions to the bugs found.

Projects I did a review for can be seen on the github ecosystem contributions issues. 
- Hop Exchange UX Audit
- PoolTogether UX Audit
- Beefy UX Audit
impactDescription:
UX is something that can be overlooked in web3 applications, as we have seen repeatedly in the past couple years. Frontends that give users access to incredible DeFi services do tend to be geared towards power users and lack intuitive user flows.

By reviewing apps UX the impact I have is to simply provide a better experience for people of all levels using these apps.

If a user who has never used DeFi before lands on a page and notices UI bugs and confusing interactions the trust in the underlying tech can be tarnished. Even if the tech under the food is incredible it won't matter because the first impression was not a 10/10.

bio: Pure Mathematician working in EVM Data Engineering. Gnosis, CoWSwap & Mintbase
contributionDescription:
Among all of my open source contributions, I believe my greatest community contributions are within and around the Data Engineering (mostly Dune Analytics) ecosystem. I have built multiple API clients (python, typescript & rust), an alerting system, an sync tool for uploading to community sources and several spells (mostly for CoW Protocol and indirectly dex.trades).

Since Dune indexes Optimisim, all of these tools are readily available for free use to all EVM compatible networks!

contributionLinks.description: Official Python Client SDK for Dune Analytics API.
NodeJS/Typescript Client for Dune Analytics API.
Rust/Cargo Library for Dune Analytics API
A general purpose tool for generating alerts from Dune query results
Dune Analytics Spellbook builds enriched tables off of raw/decoded EVM data.
Components for syncing off-chain data with Dune Community Sources

impactDescription:
1. The client SDKs (in multiple languages) allow data scientists and engineers to seamlessly integrate blockchain datasets into their backend workflows. This serves for automation, accounting, monitoring, marketing and possibly other purposes. Furthermore, this tooling allows Dune users to organize, manage, test and version control their queries to ensure correctness of their data insights. 

2. The alerting system is easily accessible and reusable for anyone in the ecosystem. It can (and has) save protocols money by detecting malicious activity. 

3. The Dune Sync project brings offchain data into the dune query engine so that it can be joined together with it's onchain companion data.

4. My spellbook contributions utilize the above tools and bring the story of a protocol to life.

fundingSources.description: I was recently/temporarily contracted out by Dune to giev the client a facelift
Some of these project were built for my employer over the course of ~3 months

bio: Onchain Magic is a mobile-first application for musicians. Live on OP mainnet.
contributionDescription:
Onchain Magic: Simplifying Onchain Music Publishing for Musicians

Problem Solved: Bringing a song to the blockchain can be daunting for musicians, demanding multiple steps from wallet creation to smart contract deployment.

Solution: Onchain Magic, at https://onchainmagic.xyz, transforms this. 

Musicians:
1. Install our Progressive Web App.
2. Sign in via Gmail; wallet creation is automatic.
3. Upload content - stories, songs, or videos.
4. Effortlessly post as a Zora Drop on Optimism for $0.17 (gas fees).

Impact: 10+ creators have used our tool, especially in hyperinflation-hit Buenos Aires, making blockchain affordable. Artists earn 0.000444 ETH per sold edition.

contributionLinks.description: Visit on mobile to download the application
private repository for the application code
Zora1155 contracts we use to deploy music-related content onchain

impactDescription:
Benefits:

- Tangible: Introduced musicians like SolSiete.eth and DavydMusic.eth to onchain publishing. Artists who never profited from social platforms now earn ETH.
- Intangible: Simplified entry into the blockchain world, enhancing Optimism's user base and showcasing a user-friendly blockchain experience.

Beneficiaries:
- Musicians: e.g., Sol Siete, DavydMusic.
- Collectives: Collaborated with MusicaW3 and Invest in Music.
- Fans: sebas.eth and bosco.eth are active participants.

Merging digital art's potential with Optimism's affordability, Onchain Magic empowers everyday musicians in the blockchain era.

bio: Rollup codes is an interactive reference specification for the rollup ecosystem.
contributionDescription:
Rollup.codes serves as an open-source developer tool, providing devs with clarity on the differences between various rollups and their stacks. The website gives information on gas costs, custom precompiles, native precompiles support, system contracts, properties of the native L1 â‡” L2 messaging protocol provided by the given rollup.

Currently, rollup.codes supports Optimism, Arbitrum, Polygon zkEVM and zkSync.

contributionLinks.description: Interactive Reference Specification for the rollups ecosystem.

impactDescription:
EVM implementations in rollups are not the same. There is no single EVM standard and each rollup has its specifics and intricacies, such as custom precompiles, opcodes etc.

For rollup developers, this info is usually hard to find and they have to dive deep into the rollups codebase, as documentation is more often than not - unsatisfactory. Rollup.codes is a comprehensive website showcasing each rollup's most important developers' information. Our goal is for it to become the go-to place for rollup developers.

Rollup.codes helps developers leveraging the OP stack understand the differences between the OP stack and the Ethereum EVM, as well as between the OP stack and other rollups.

Since launch, we've had 1100 unique users over the past 2.5 months.

bio: Snapshot is a voting platform that allows DAOs to vote without gas fees.
contributionDescription:
Snapshot has been used both by the Optimism Collective and 64 projects on Optimism to facilitate governance. All of these services have been provided for free, both for governance participants and the projects themselves. This has allowed Optimism to be the most active layer 2 in terms of governance and establish a strong ideological stance of decentralization and participative decision-making in the entire ecosystem. Snapshot allows projects to conduct votes that most of the people reading this forum have participated in.

Since the start of Optimismâ€™s governance:

1.15M votes have been cast in the Optimism collectiveâ€™s governance on 93 proposals.
88650 participants have voted, which means the average participant has voted 13 times on average, the highest number for any major DAO.

contributionLinks.description: This is the main repository of Snapshot Labs.
Repo for Snapshot X, our EVM onchain voting framework.

impactDescription:
Snapshot is the most widely used tool across the Optimism ecosystem to facilitate governance. Even though the Collective has stopped using it in favor of on-chain voting, today we have 491 spaces on Snapshot that call Optimism their home.

We've provided these services for free because we believe governance is for everyone, and we like to think that we're building the framework for new types of organizations to thrive. In addition, we're working on a new on-chain voting framework we call Snapshot X that will soon be available on Optimism and will be much more flexible than Compound Governor.

bio: OP Reth is Reth but for the Optimism Collective, a new high performance client.
contributionDescription:
The OP Stack is built to be modular, and allows any EL to plug as long as it's following the spec. We proceeded to adjust Reth, a new EL for Ethereum, to be compatible with the OP Stack by adding support for Deposit transactions, the new Engine API modifications and more. This brings down OP Stack chain sizes down by >5x and provides improved runtime performance which we have yet to benchmark concretely vs OP Mainnet.

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/pull/4377

contributionLinks.description: This is the main PR where the bulk of the work has been done.

impactDescription: These contributions will hopefully enable a more performant OP Stack which will ultimately allow the Optimism Collective to scale its vision to the masses. We intend to continue maintaining this work and make sure that it keeps up with any changes that the OP Stack has over the next years.

bio: Collective of people from Berlin: Protocol Berg, Goerli Testnet.
contributionDescription:
The Department of Decentralization is a collective of people from various crypto- and blockchain communities in and around Berlin. The group assembled to organize events like ETHBerlin, Protocol Berg, or GoerliCon and has been providing infrastructure such as the Goerli and (soon) the HoleÅ¡ky testnet.

We aim to be an agnostic vehicle to drive adoption, educate newcomers, and raise awareness of the challenges and benefits of decentralization and open-source software.

Optimism benefits from public infrastructure such as the Goerli testnet, which has been the primary layer-1 for the optimistic Goerli testnet in the past year.  In addition, the Optimism Foundation has been represented at the past year's ETHBerlin and Protocol Berg.

bio: I'm leading the Optimism Prime project and building DeFi tools for the community
contributionDescription:
In late 2021, the Optimism Prime project has been abandoned by its original team. OPP was the first meme token listed on Velodrome and the project was baked by a good veVELO position accumulated thanks to its community.
I've took the lead of the project so it can survive, with the goal of contributing to the whole Optimism ecosystem as a community project.

In that context, I've started working on the Autobribes protocol. It's goal is to act as liquidity incentivization layer that supports Velodrome by locking tokens instead of dumping. Users stake their LP on Autobribes and are rewarded with "real yield", while Autobribes farm and lock VELO. The real yield is obtained from bribe chasing. Two instances have been deployed on Optimism: the "Reliquary Prime", and "Autobribes for Velodrome".

contributionLinks.description: This article explains the Reliquary Prime: the first instance of Autobribes
This article explains Autobribes as a general ve(3,3) layer 2 protocol

impactDescription:
While Autobribes still has a low TVL, I'm convinced it can bring new liquidity providers to Velodrome which is the leading DEX of Optimism.
Many retail liquidity providers are interested in being paid with real yield instead of farm & dump. Autobribes offer this service while contributing to the Velodrome ecosystem.

On the developer ecosystem side, I've forked and improved the "Reliquary system" from byte masons. This is a staking smart contract that rewards long term participants.
By integrating the Reliquary with Velodrome, I've contributed to bring a new DeFi primitive that can be used as a layer on top of any ve(3,3) DEX.

bio: Open Source Ethereum Explorer
contributionDescription:
beaconcha.in explorer is the backbone for Ethereum's consensus and execution layer. It is the only all-in-one (CL+EL) explorer and played a pivotal role during the merge and subsequent hardforks. Due to its design, core devs use beaconcha.in to simulate and test upcoming hardforks.

To support for homestakers and decentralization, beaconcha.in provides an open-source mobile app for both iOS and Android, aiming to enhance the solo staking experience.

Currently, the codebase is undergoing significant rework to support any EVM chain, including the Optimism network.

contributionLinks.description: Repository of the beaconcha.in web project.
Repository of the beaconcha.in mobile app.

impactDescription:
- beaconcha.in is the *only* consensus layer explorer in the ecosystem.

- Easy way for Local Explorer and Testnet Simulation
gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer/tree/master/local-deployment

-  A significant backend rework to allow anyone spin up any EVM explorer, thus giving developers a new playground for the OP stack

- Seamless User Navigation through Network Data:
End users can navigate network-related data, without noticing the various layers of the Ethereum stack (CL/EL/L2).

- Improved Staking Experience with our Open Source Mobile App
Our open-source mobile app allows for monitoring of validators, enhancing the staking experience and contributing to decentralization.

- Public API Access for Consensus and Execution Layer. beaconcha.in is the only CL API provider in the ecosystem.

contributionDescription: As a researcher and data analyst at M3TA, I've contributed to Optimism by creating a dashboard aimed at offering users a comprehensive view of its activities and financial health. Collaborating with my co-researchers at 4Pillars, we've initiated a series on Modular Blockchains. My specific focus lies in Rollup Economics, where I analyze the Cost, Revenue, and Profit Models of layer-2 blockchains, including Optimism, zkSync, and zkEVM. These efforts aim to provide valuable insights into Optimism's economic aspects and its role in the blockchain ecosystem.
impactDescription: My contributions have had a positive impact on the Optimism Collective by enhancing the understanding of Optimism's activities and financial health. The creation of a dedicated dashboard provides Optimism users with valuable insights, empowering them to make informed decisions. Additionally, my work on Rollup Economics, alongside co-researchers at 4Pillars, has contributed to a broader comprehension of Optimism's economic dynamics and its place within the modular blockchain landscape. This knowledge fosters a more comprehensive and informed approach within the Optimism Collective, aiding in strategic planning and decision-making.

contributionDescription:
Cryptodevs are the largest Crypto developer community in the space. We are completely free, with a pure volunteer team, and aim to bring developers up to standard for Ethereum, Optimism as well as all other networks as a completely network agnostic and neutral space. We help new devs with any support they need, provide connections to careers through partners, help to give developers a platform to grow and build the next gen of dApps and core protocols.

Cryptodevs is a community that's 13k developers strong. We have helped developers go from unknowns to core developers at protocols such as Polygon, Opensea, Prysm and more through support, networking and a general environment to build in a no shill, completely free and open space.

bio: Student
contributionDescription:
Developing the Optimism Virtual Machine (OVM): The OVM is a new type of virtual machine that is specifically designed for running Optimistic Rollups. I helped to design and implement the OVM, which is a key component of the Optimism network.
Contributing to the Optimism Sequencer: The Optimism Sequencer is a piece of software that coordinates the execution of transactions on the Optimism network. I helped to develop and improve the Optimism Sequencer, which is essential for the smooth operation of the network.
impactDescription:
My work on the OVM has helped to make it a reliable and efficient platform for running Ethereum smart contracts. The OVM is now used by a wide range of projects, including some of the largest and most popular decentralized applications on Ethereum.

My work on the Optimism Sequencer has helped to improve the performance and scalability of the Optimism network. The Optimism Sequencer is now able to process thousands of transactions per second, making Optimism one of the fastest and most scalable Layer 2 scaling solutions for Ethereum.

bio: A DeFi enthusiast obsessed with layer 2 and Ethereum development
contributionDescription:
I've played a significant role in educating the blockchain community through informative threads about the OP Stack narrative. These threads focus on Optimistic Rollups, a key element of the OP Stack, and its implications for the broader Optimism ecosystem.

The OP Stack is a critical advancement in Ethereum scalability, and my threads have made it easier for both newcomers and experienced enthusiasts to understand its significance. In summary, my goal has been to inform and prepare readers for the evolving landscape of blockchain technology, fostering anticipation and confidence in the Optimism ecosystem.

bio: Harness the power of blockchain to create an equitable future for all.

The Optimism Collective's commitment to transparency and collaboration stood out. Through the collective, I learned that blockchain's true power lies in its communities.

impactDescription:
Goals and Objectives:
1. Simplify Onboarding.
2. Increase User Adoption.
3. Community Engagement.
4. Educational Resources.

Challenges Faced:
Integrating Optimism's Layer 2 solution with Perpetual Protocol presented technical challenges that required extensive collaboration with developers. Educating users about Layer 2 technology and the advantages of using Optimism required a concerted effort through clear and accessible resources.

Scaling Impact: Our success will serve as a model for fostering user adoption and onboarding across other blockchain projects, ultimately contributing to the growth of the entire blockchain ecosystem.

bio: Helping Mass Adoption
contributionDescription:
At inbest we are a bridge between the cutting edge blockchain technologies and the end users who do not understand it, sometime is hard to find information other than the extensive documentation that gets to technical for most users.

Our role is to find this information, digest it, and then feed it to the audience on a specific manner that tends to be easier to understand. 

In spanish is even more dificult to find objective and well created content that explains this technologies and how they work so that the regular users gain more interest!

this will greatly impact the growth and adoption of the SuperChain! 

if you type "la super cadena op" you will see a lot of "airdrop" videos, but only one actually explaining the technology and talking about the op stack in spanish.

the cannel has many vids about OP, and we want to grow and keep creating

impactDescription:
the impact Inbest Program has generated at the time, might not be the numbers we want, but we are still growing, we have been providing the spanish speaking audience with information about optimism and the technology behind the op stack, the benefit of the modularity, the problems it solve and how to get involved.

not only for user but also for developers who want information on this topics like the op stack and the benefits of developing with this technology, like using the op stack to create a rollup that will run as the execution layer and how thanks to modularity we can commbine that with data availability solutions and much more

if granted any amount of tokens, everything will go to the quality and reach of our videos, in order to accomplish our goal of helping mass adoption!

bio: The Graph organizes and makes usable web3 data for dapps via GraphQL.
contributionDescription:
The Graph has supported Optimism since the initial launch of mainnet. More on that here: https://thegraph.com/blog/graph-optimistic-ethereum/. 

Since Optimism mainnet launch, The Graph's hosted service, subsidized by The Graph ecosystem (meaning completely free for dapps) has served:

22.7B queries
1.15K subgraphs
with a 99.97% query success rate.

Over the past 30 days alone, The Graph has served 1.24B queries.
Also, The Graph supports Optimism Goerli and Kovan, and on testnet has served:

Goerli
1.24B queries
272 subgraphs
99.98% query success

Kovan
173M queries
154 subraphs
99.99% query success

bio: I write about crypto-related topics like governance, sustainability and scaling.
contributionDescription: I have written over 100 blog posts about rollups and governance, in addition to countless Reddit & Twitter posts, with the caveat they are not specifically related to Optimism but about rollups in general. All my writings are public domain, and anyone can remix/republish/adapt etc as they please. I've been an Optimism Collective delegate since day 1, and governance has been a key topic in my writings in the last year or so, inspired by my work as a delegate, aimed partly at improving Optimism's governance systems and onboarding more people to Optimism's governance. Kindly note that I'm a recipient for RPGF #2, so it may be prudent to consider my more recent writings about topics like governance for RPGF #3.
impactDescription: The impact of writers is harder to gauge with metrics. I could post viewing stats and social media numbers, but instead, let me try something different. Here's my pitch: have you, as a badgeholder, read my content and in some way informed & influenced your thoughts and work? Or your colleagues, friends, and teams building on Optimism? It's not for me to say how impactful my writing has been - so I'll let badgeholders be the judge. Kindly also note that I'm no longer active on Twitter, but still write on Mirror, Farcaster and Reddit with a smaller audience than in the past, so you may consider that when you gauge "impact".

bio: We creates guides, instructional videos, and technical support about staking.
contributionDescription: EthStaker's goal is to keep Ethereum decentralized. We do this by creating educational materials and by offering technical support to encourage people to run their own nodes and to stake at home. To keep Ethereum decentralized we need a diverse set of many people to run different combinations of execution and consensus clients all around the world. If too much of the Ethereum network is controlled by a small amount of people this damages Ethereum's credible neutrality and it could no longer serve effectively as the base layer for projects like Optimism.

contributionLinks.description: A collection of useful information and concepts about Ethereum staking.

impactDescription: While we may not contribute directly to Optimism, we feel that without a secure and decentralized Ethereum mainnet, Optimism could not succeed in it's mission. Without Optimism Ethereum is much less useful. EthStaker's and Optimism's values, goals, and incentives are aligned.

bio: I am a photographer and minimalist
contributionDescription:
As a photographer focused on documenting technological progress, I'm thrilled to share images that help tell Optimism's story. Through my lens, I strive to capture the collaborative spirit and groundbreaking work happening here.

Some of my favorite shots show programmers deep in thoughtful discussion, refining ideas that could revolutionize how we build for the future. Whiteboards fill with diagrams as concepts become code, step by step, line by line. I also love capturing the "aha!" moments â€“ when pushing past tough problems leads to breakthroughs. Those victorious smiles say so much about the dedication in overcoming challenges.
impactDescription:
I've had the privilege of visually documenting their important work over the past year. While the tech itself is groundbreaking, through my lens I've sought to capture the powerful human impact as well.

Some of my photos from their community events and workshops have really helped spread awareness of the Collective's role in furthering blockchain accessibility. Sharing images of their educational sessions has inspired more people from diverse backgrounds to get involved.

bio: Castle is a multi-chain EOA and multi-sig aggregator for NFTs and coins on OP.
contributionDescription:
We help users manage multiple wallets on Optimism and Base blockchains. Users can connect multiple EOAs, multi-sigs (across both Optimism and Base) and manage their NFTs and coins. We integrate with NFT marketplaces and 0x to enable trading on Optimism and Base too.

The multi-sig creation process on our app is simplified. We leverage CREATE2 and multi-send to streamline onboarding for users. Users can securely manage their assets across major chains through us.
impactDescription: Multi-sigs and managing multiple wallets is difficult. We made the wallet experience as easy as can be for users starting in crypto. With apps like Friend Tech, AdWorld, etc. users are required to hold various types of assets across many wallets. Castle prioritizes chains like Optimism and Base to ensure that new users can easily manage all their assets in one place.

bio: Scry is the ONLY self-hostable oracle infra. With crosschain data, VRFs and more
contributionDescription: Scry has directly enabled new use cases like being able to allow a mint for an NFT held on ETH or Base to unlock access on OP, or for games, or to allow protocols to distribute fees on other protocols to token holders on OP or even access assets on other networks such as Base to allow for easy compatibility in an increasing diverse space, especially with OP Stack.

contributionLinks.description: All the Scry protocol tools and contracts
Veryfi, which allows any asset on any network to be verified on Optimism
The community operated and independant nodes, currently 3 other independants
Simple to use docs for oracle deployment by ANYONE
Contract that allows developers to choose which oracles to source data from
Morpheus contracts for decentralized, self hostable oracles with NO intermediary

impactDescription:
Scrys tools have directly enabled new, unique use cases such as Veryfi, which is a dapp that lets users verify their assets on any other chain, such as NFTs, ERC20s on other networks, allowing Optimism to attract projects on any network to it without needing their users to move assets or relaunch, allowing for easy bootstrapping and compatibility for any project that wants to use OP for new uses without full redeployment.

By enabling anyone to run their own oracle, Scry has democratized the oracle space, with full control over their data and allows for easy bootstrapping of data onto OP Stack chains (we were the first oracle deployed on Base). Developers can now access any data they need without relying on 3p providers, ensuring data integrity and reducing potential points of failure.
